required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Proton Therapy for Chordomas and/or Chondrosarcomas
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Outcomes Protocol of Proton Beam Radiation Therapy for Chordomas and/or Chondrosarcomas of the Base of Skull and/or Spine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect information from medical records to see what effects proton beam radiation has on cancer and analyze possible side effects.

detailed_description.textblock: Data collection will be obtained from the patient's medical records including initial evaluation, pathology report, dosimetry information, radiotherapy completion records and follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze outcome data on tumor control.
primary_outcome.time_frame: When each patient has been followed for a minimum of 12 month and then again after 24 months to a maximum of 10 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze data on normal tissue morbidity.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When each patient has been followed for a minimum of 12 months and then again after 24 months to a maximum of 10 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Specifically analyzing pituitary, visual and hearing function.

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated at a radiation oncology clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically proven chordoma or chondrosarcoma.
- Sites: base of skull and/or spine.
- Age 18 years or older.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous radiation to the head and neck or brain.
- Evidence of metastatic disease.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

facility.name: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

link.description: Contact the University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute
